intro: Diosma praecox, commonly known as early diosma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a slight pubescence, while its flowers are small and white or pale green. Diosma praecox is an herbaceous perennial that blooms in early spring, contributing to the biodiversity of its native ecosystems.
